results.title: Flash trip to the beach
results.brief_description: This home movie takes us back to an era when holidays seemed longer, days sunnier and road safety was much less of an issue. Older Bayside residents will be interested in scenes taken of Brighton streets and the Kinane Street beach. A man and a boy take a trip to the beach on the back of a motorbike.
results.description: This home movie takes us back to an era when holidays seemed longer, days sunnier and road safety was much less of an issue. results.title: How to make a movie
results.brief_description: Although short and largely created to practise the Straford Brothers’ unique approach to editing and transitions, this already shows their ambitions for scene and story. Here, a frustrated filmmaker tries to make a ‘classic.’
results.description: Although short and largely created to practise the Straford Brothers’ unique approach to editing and transitions, this already shows their ambitions for scene and story. Here, a frustrated filmmaker tries to make a ‘classic.’

results.title: Little Claude - a'hunting he will go
results.brief_description: The Straford Brothers’ first attempt at a hand drawn animation. Frank recalls that it was done by drawing on a single cell, filming it, then rubbing it out and drawing the next frame on top, “a pretty laborious way to make an animation.”

results.title: The Tattoo
results.creator_credit: Michael Burnside, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The story of Michael Burnside’s dad’s tattoo encompasses a far broader history of family, migration, separation and life of a man who has come a long way.

results.title: Workman's nightmare
results.brief_description:
An early experiment filmed in the Straford backyard in Brighton. It features the acting debut of 14 year-old John - as a workman who tussles with an unruly ladder.
This short work from 1951 marked the boys earliest efforts.

results.title: Essence of Terror
results.brief_description: An inquisitive young boy explores the contents of the medicine cabinet and is tempted into trying the jar labelled ‘Adol Essence’… He is plunged into a world of terror as his body starts to change in alarming new ways.

results.title: How does your garden grow?
results.creator_credit: George Cass, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Kevin Heinze shows young students various aspects of gardening using simple techniques suitable for the classroom. Topics covered in this 5 part series are: 1) Sowing seeds; 2) Propagating plants; 3) Potting up; 4) Carnivorous plants; 5) Arbor Week.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Cass, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions
